content:
Hi Žan, Is this a new account and you can't connect or it's your existing account that stopped working?

0.Check your internet connection: Make sure you have a stable internet connection and that your network is not blocking SMTP traffic. 1.Check gmail server status (https://www.google.com/appsstatus/dashboard/): 2.Check SMTP server settings: Ensure that you have entered the correct SMTP server settings for Gmail. The SMTP server for Gmail is smtp.gmail.com and the port number is 465 or 587. Also, make sure you have enabled the “Allow less secure apps” option in your Gmail account settings. 3.Disable antivirus or firewall temporarily: Disable any antivirus or firewall programs temporarily as they may be blocking the SMTP traffic. 4. Check your VPN client wether it disables the SMTP ports

content: OK. In normal startup, try disabling Hardware Acceleration in settings. Does that help?
creator: wsmwk

content:
I didn't see that someone already have the same problem, the fix is (from thread"Mouse scroll wheel not working anywhere in V115"): "Start TB in normal mode, disable hardware acceleration in Settings/General/Indexing, restart TB, test the scrolling."

Thanks for help, now I can back from bad Outlook and I'm very happy ;)

content: Ho già provato tutte le indicazioni che mi hai fornito, le avevo già lette e applicate a più riprese, sperando che fosse un problema che sarebbe stato risolto con i continui aggiornamenti. Il problema si è verificato in occasione, appunto, dell'aggiornamento degli account gmail. Per tutti gli altri account l'aggiornamento è andato bene, mentre per questo account ha cominciato ad apparire il popup che ho indicato. Infatti da allora ho dovuto impostare in gmail il reindirizzamento della posta su un secondo account. Però tutte le volte che chiedo di scaricare i messaggi su tutti gli account, questo popup appare e non posso fare altro che chiuderlo, senza poter scaricare i messaggi, così come non posso utilizzare l'account per inviare messaggi tramite Thunderbird. Quello che mi sembra strano è quello che accade quando premo il pulsante Consenti o Rifiuta nel popup. Dopo la pressione del tasto, entrambi i tasti vengono disabilitati, ma poi non accade più nulla. Ho provato anche ad aspettare qualche ora, ma il popup rimane aperto; se lo chiudo, lo scaricamento dei messaggi prosegue dall'account successivo.
creator: poliplead

content: Se hai letto le discussioni che ti indicato, avrai notato che non sei il solo in questa situazione assurda. Le stesse configurazioni funzionano per alcuni e non per altri. A volte funzionano per un account e non per un altro impostato in maniera identica. Posso solo suggerirti di chiedere a Google del perché di questa anomalia.

content: It's rather easy: create an ico file of the traditional Thunderbird icon, put it in the same folder as Thunderbird (this step may not be mandatory), and the rightclick on desktop and select properties and then select change icon and select your ico and you're done. Like you, I find the new icon objectionable and confusing and too alike to other icons. It was a shot in the foot to abandon the classic priceless Thunderbird icon, and my taskbar still shows the old, as well as icon on desktop.
creator: davidsk

content: Thank you david, but this did not work on my side, I tried it before posting my post. You can change in described way: 1. icon on desktop (shortcut icon), 2. Icon in Quick launch (moved this shortcut), 3. Icon on taskbar (pinned program) but only until you open Thunderbird. After opening TB the icon change (on my side) to the default one (blue fox with white envelope). See attached pictures. I have also tried to delete C:\Users\YourUsername\AppData\Local\Microsoft\Windows\Explorer\iconcache.db file, which was somewhere mentioned. I agree, that the change of the default icon without differentiation from other existing programs was a BIG mistake of the Mozzilla company.

content: Well, I don't know what magic I'm employing. I have win 11, an ico file (201 kb), named thunderbird.ico, filed in the same directory as thunderbird.exe. Other than that, I don't know what makes it work. But I'm glad that it does.
creator: davidsk

content: Depending on how completely you uninstalled, it may still be in an unused profile. I'm not familiar with version 60, but if the setup is the same, look in c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird\profiles This will have one or more profile folders. Look in each for a file named abook.sqlite. If in more than one profile, the larger one or recently updated one would be it. If you find it, it doesn't work with version 60.
creator: davidsk

content:
I have spent the last few days working in detail with Moosend. Having arrived at the point email settings could be seen to be working correctly via SMTPer they said this:

"Thank you for getting back to us.

Since you got the success message on smtper.net when using the same settings as you are using in Thunderbird, it seems like the issue is probably related to the Thunderbird side I am afraid.

Here are some articles that are available on Thunderbird's site that reported similar issues that you are experiencing: 

   https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1375736    https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1389726

Would it be possible for you to check it out with the support team of Thunderbird since they should be able to have more experience with handling your Thunderbird setup to check the reason behind it?"

So here I am. Based on the error message I'm not sure where the problem lies or what settings to change.

Regards, Robert

content: I suggest trying a combination of STARTTLS and 587 and then a combination of SSL/TLS and 465. I'm just not sure what works. I suggest that because the screenshots didn't include all info.

content: Easy, it's called 'unified folders' in Thunderbird. Assuming you are on current release (115), click the three dots to the right of 'new message' button and click folder modes and then unified folders.
creator: davidsk

content: For two accounts, you must have two SMTP servers. They may be to the same email host, but with different email ids. Give each one unique descriptions so you will be able to easily verify that you are establishing the right one for each account. What you're doing used to work okay, but tighter restrictions being imposed by email providers requires this.
creator: davidsk

creator: jrelay5

content: That's the standard OAuth2 authentication window for gmail accounts. Check that cookies are accepted in TB Settings/Privacy & Security, remove any entries for the account in Saved Passwords, restart TB, and see if the process completes when you enter the account password in the window. A VPN or some antivirus apps like AVG/Avast could also be blocking.
creator: sfhowes

creator: sheilahubbard2

content:
Click the manual config. button in the account setup and try these settings:

incoming POP or IMAP server: mail.got.net, port 995 (POP) or 993 (IMAP), SSL/TLS security, authentication = normal password, User Name = email address

outgoing SMTP server: mx.got.net, port 587, STARTTLS security, authentication = normal password, User Name = email address

https://www.got.net/support/
creator: sfhowes

content: I suggest you replace 'sheilah' as user name with the full email address. I also saw this website at https://gotnet.net/support/ that indicated the outgoing server to be smtp.got.net. You could try that if mx.got.net causes problems.
